hod_desk.name: Dr. S.N. Mahalakshmi
additional_info: Dr. S.N. Mahalakshmi, a distinguished scholar, boasts an illustrious academic journey marked by an unwavering commitment to the English language pedagogy and scholarly exploration
Armed with M.A., M.Phil, Ph.D., Dr. Mahalakshmi commands an impressive 23 years of relentless dedication to the domain of English language teaching and profound research endeavours
Her scholarly footprint is evident through the remarkable tally of 27 publications in esteemed international and national journals

Furthermore, she has graced several platforms such as 18 international and national conferences with her erudition, delivering captivating presentations that illuminate the forefront of linguistic inquiry
An author of 12 seminal textbooks and workbooks tailored to the rigorous standards of technical English pertaining to Anna University syllabus

Her publications serve as guiding beacons, nurturing the linguistic prowess of countless students. It is noteworthy to mention that seven of them have been awarded Ph.D under her able guidance. Currently, 2 research scholars are pursuing part-time Ph.D. in the area of English Language Teaching and Literature

As the Head of the Department of Science and Humanities at Anna University Regional Campus, Coimbatore, she orchestrates academic excellence with finesse, shaping the intellects of future generations along with her erudite members of faculty

assistant_professors.name: Dr. Marshal Anthoni S
assistant_professors.position: Associate Professor, Department of Science & Humanities (Mathematics)
assistant_professors.additional_info: Hailing from P.Puliampatti, a small town in Erode district, Marshal Anthoni did his schooling in the Government schools in and around P.Puliampatti. Then as a proud alumnus of Gobi Arts and Science College, Gobichettipalayam, he received his B.Sc., M.Sc., degrees in Mathematics and as a University Department Scholar he received his M.Phil., and Ph.D. degrees in Mathematics from Bharathiar University, Coimbatore, India, in 1993, 1995, 1996, and 2001, respectively. For a brief period, he served as a Lecturer in the Department of Mathematics, Kumaraguru College of Technology, Coimbatore. From April 2003 to Dec 2004, he was a BK21 Post-Doctoral Fellow in the Department of Mathematics, Yonsei University, Seoul, South Korea. After that he joined as a Lecturer in the Department of Mathematics, Periyar University, Salem till Aug 2008. He then moved to the Department of Mathematics, Anna University of Technology (AUT), Coimbatore as an Assistant Professor in Aug 2008 and then promoted as an Associate Professor from Aug 2011. Now he is continuing his Teaching and Research Career in Anna University Regional Campus, Coimbatore after the merger of all AUTs with Anna University, Chennai since Aug 2012. He has published over 90 research papers in reputed Science Citation Indexed journals. He has served as a program committee member, and a reviewer for various international journals and international conferences. He delivered invited talks in several Universities and institutes in India and Abroad. He has visited Japan, Spain, Brazil, Canada, Switzerland, China, South Korea, Nepal and Oman for academic purposes. His current research interest is in the field of Systems and Control Theory. His students after the completion of their Ph.D. are now working in esteemed institutions at USA, Luxembourg, Israel, Japan, South Korea, China, and Taiwan.

assistant_professors.name: Dr. K. Rajasekar
assistant_professors.profile: Dr. K. Rajasekar holds a B.Sc and M.Sc in Chemistry from Govt Arts College, Salem, affiliated with the University of Madras. He earned his Ph.D. in Chemistry from Anna University Guindy Campus, Chennai in 2007 and pursued post-doctoral research at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT), USA during 2009-2010. Recognized for his research potential, he was awarded the Raman Fellowship by UGC in 2016-17, conducting research at the National Renewable Energy Laboratory, Denver, USA. Dr. Rajasekar has received funding from the Department of Science and Technology for several projects. With over 40 research publications in esteemed journals such as Nature Nanotechnology, he currently supervises four Ph.D. candidates. He serves as a regular referee for prestigious journals including Materials Science & Engineering B and Journal of Hazardous Materials. His research interests encompass 2D materials, Catalysis, Multifunctional Nanomaterials for renewable energy, and low-dimensional carbon materials.

assistant_professors.name: Dr. Kalugasalam P
assistant_professors.description: Dr. Kalugasalam P was born on 27th December 1970 in Dharmapuri (village), Theni District, Tamil Nadu, India. He completed his Secondary School Education from P. H. N. Higher Secondary School, Kamatchipuram, Theni District in 1987 and Higher Secondary Education from the same school in 1989. He completed his UG degree from Government Arts College, Coimbatore with first class in 1992, PG degree from PSG College of Arts and Science, Coimbatore with first class in 1994, M.Phil. degree from PSG College of Arts and Science, Coimbatore in 1999, and Ph.D. from Anna University, Chennai in 2010. He joined SPM Matriculation Higher Secondary Schools, Coimbatore as a postgraduate teacher in physics in 2000 and then joined the Department of Science and Humanities, Tamilnadu College of Engineering, Coimbatore as a Lecturer in 2004. He is currently working as the Professor and Head of the Department of Science and Humanities at the same Institute. He has thirty-eight papers to his credit in international referred journals. He has presented research papers in International and National seminars, received two best paper awards, and published five books for first-year B.E./B.Tech. students. He is also a reviewer for the book “Engineering Physics” published by McGraw Hill Education India Pvt. Ltd., New Delhi. He was awarded the “Bharat Ratna Mother Teresa Gold Medal Award-2014” by the Global Economic Progress and Research Association.
